Taylor claims YUSU funding at 'breaking point'

By James Bithell

University responds: "In no sense could YUSU be said to be short of funds"

Undergraduate dropout rate doubles in four years

The University's dropout rate for first year undergraduates living on campus has doubled in the past four years.

Growing inequality in application process

Figures have revealed the gap between UK BME and UK White offers has widened and offers to state school applicants have decreased.

YUSU to tackle rent issues for international students

YUSU have promised to tackle the issue of international students being forced to pay six months or more rent up front if they are unable to provide a UK guarantor.

350 student flats to be built at York Press offices

Plans to build 350 student flats on the site of the York Press offices have been announced.

York residents consider students 'noisy and 'inconsiderate' according to survey

A Survey has been conducted to examine what residents of York think of their student neighbours.

Unions bid for Boris Bikes

The student unions of the University of York, York St. John and York College are proposing a joint bid to introduce a bike hire scheme to the city of York similar to that of the 'Boris Bike' in London

Students to take part in York Pride event

Students have been invited to take part in the seventh annual York Pride event, which will be taking place on Saturday 1st June.

Rowers awarded PS10,000 grant

Two club members have raised nearly PS10,000 for the University of York Boat Club.

GSA elections hit by shortage of candidates

By James Bithell

Four of the six positions for the Graduate Student's Association Principal Officer Elections have only one person running.

University opposes bus stop plans

York City Council is planning to move the Library Bridge bus stop at the expense of the University.

Yatterbox attracts national interest

A company created by ex-University students, which monitors the tweets of UK politicians, is gaining national interest after teaming up with a London based communications agency.

What did Brian do wrong?

By James Bithell

Chauffeurs, croquet and CBEs. Amy Blumsom looks at the highs and lows of a career that never won the hearts of the student body.

Facebook group shows York students like a different sort of shag

By James Bithell

An alternative 'rate your shag' Facebook group has been set up in the name of carpet appreciation.

Students face down EDL protest with a cuppa

Bull Lane Mosque opened its doors to a crowd of over 100 turned on Sunday afternoon, after rumours of a rally surfaced on social, also serving tea to the few attendant EDL protesters.

Twitter raises fears of York EDL rally

By James Bithell

According to Twitter, there is a planned protest by fascist group EDL tomorrow at 2pm at Bull Lane Mosque

New York Sport Committee revealed

By James Bithell

The results of the York Sport Committee elections were released this morning

Tinchy Stryder announced as second YUSU Summer Ball headliner

By James Bithell

Rapper Tinchy Stryder has been announced as the second headliner for YUSU's Summer Ball

York MP votes for Gay Marriage amendment

Julian Sturdy, the MP for York Outer, has voted in favour of the controversial amendment to the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Bill.

Students safer after Retreat Lane receives lighting

By James Bithell

The dark lane, which has long been a safety concern, finally receives lighting thanks to a deal between the University and Council

Futureheads announced as first Summer Ball headliner

YUSU have announced post-punk band The Futureheads as the first leading act for the 2013 Summer Ball at York Racecourse

Femsoc row erupts on social networks

By James Bithell

Bob Hughes, Welfare Officer has released a statement on behalf of YUSU in response to the fallout concerning the Union's decision not to ratify Femsoc (now University of York Feminists [UYF]).

Men's Rights Society was 'a joke from the start'

By James Bithell

"I would like it to be known that I have realised how much upset this has caused, and am truly sorry that the group I started got so out of control. I've woken up to the reaction this morning and am truly horrified"

YUSU support Goodricke's compensation claim

YUSU has revealed it will push for a compensation settlement due to the water problems Goodricke College has been experiencing all year.

FemSoc receives nationwide support

By James Bithell

Feminist Societies from universities across the country in addition to a number of political societies have spoken out in support of FemSoc after its application for ratification was rejected by YUSU.

University boycotts unpaid internships

By James Bithell

The University believes it is unfair graduates are expected to work free for up to a year on their possible career, because only students from richer families can afford to take part.

NUS adopt Evidence Based Drug Policy

The National Union of Students have adopted an 'Evidence Based Drug Policy', a motion put forward by YUSU.

Ms Dynamite announced as final Big D headliner

By James Bithell

Ms Dynamite, born Niomi Arleen MacLean-Daley, is a double Brit Award and three time MOBO Awards winning R&B, UK garage, hip hop singer and rapper.

No Platform, Sun and EU motions defeated in referendum

By James Bithell

The only policy that was passed was the issue of whether YUSU employees should a living wage, in which 875 students voted in favour of passing as opposed to only 299 who voted against the issue.

University pay out PS500k to silence staff

The University has spent nearly half a million pounds on controversial gagging orders, known in legal terms as agreements containing confidentiality clauses.
